content.prompt: Which of the following best explains a limitation of the data in the maps?

choices.label: There are fewer people in eastern China than in western China, which makes the data in the maps difficult to interpret.
The missing data for Taiwan must be included in the maps before it is possible to make an accurate comparison over time.
The population of China is increasing for all age-groups, so the data in the maps are unrepresentative of population issues as a whole.
The maps do not show data for age-groups other than those aged 65 and over, so it is difficult to contextualize these data.

unit.text: 5: Political and Economic Changes and Development

topic.text: 5.8: Causes and Effects of Demographic Change

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Explain possible limitations of the data provided.
